Description: Shoulder sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly a hydria; exterior: black band at top; below, black-figure decoration consisting of horse and rider to left (part of horse’s neck, mane, shoulder and back with saddlecloth; blobs in added white in loops of neck band and white dots for reins; nude youthful rider, only part of left foreleg missing; added red for hair and traces of red dot rosette for nipple).
Curator's comments: According to Venit, the sherd may belong to the same vase as Alexandria 9563 (Venit 1988, 46, no. 163). For parallels regarding the subject matter, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.130.10.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.14.3)
